Instance.description: A worker NPC is a Sim that will come to your lot perform specific tasks. They are simple, autonomy driven NPCs that are akin to service NPCs but do not require the complexity of schedule management or the ability to be hired, fired, paid, etc.

TunableTuple.name: _end_work_test
TunableTuple.description: When the worker NPC runs this interaction, the situation will end.

TunableList.name: affordance_lists
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in Affordances or these Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceList tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in this list or Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.name: consider_all_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled for any reason. If this box is checked and consider_user_cancelled_as_failure is not checked, user cancel's will still be treated as failures.

Tunable.name: consider_user_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled by the user.

TunableVariant.name: interaction_outcome
TunableVariant.description: The interaction's outcome must match the outcome tuned here to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: This is the role the sim in question should be to pass.

TunableList.name: skill_tags
TunableList.description: Skill tags to check against skill attached to the interaction, determined by if the interaction identifies it in skill loot data, or if it is an associated skill in the outcome. If you are setting this and are not using affordances or lists for filtering, you probably want to ensure that you set interaction tags that are more or equally restrictive to either one of Interaction_Super or Interaction_Mixer. And do not use Interaction_All, unless you really want to trigger for both mixers and super interactions.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either an interaction matching one of these Tags or an affordance from the list of Affordances in this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: target_filters
TunableTuple.description: Restrictions on the target of this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_states
TunableVariant.description: Limit test success only to target objects that are in certain states

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object must have this definition.

TunableTuple.name: tag
TunableTuple.description: The object must have this tag.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the states in the state set against the objects in the inventory.

TunableVariant.name: object_tags
TunableVariant.description: Object tags for limiting test success to a subset of target objects.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Target object tags and how they are tested.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: A set of tags to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.description: A tag to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the target object.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on. InteractionStart: Triggers when the interaction starts. InteractionComplete: Triggers when the interaction ends. This is best used with a one shot interaction. It will not get called if an interaction is canceled. If you have a Sim parked in an interaction that you can only exit via cancel, you will not hit this. InteractionUpdate: Triggers on a 15 sim minute cadence from the start of the interaction. If the interaction ends before a cycle is up it does not trigger. Do not use this for short interactions as it has a possibility of never getting an update for an interaction.

TunableVariant.name: _visit_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then the worker NPC will enter a visit situation for the specified duration.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The duration of the worker NPC's visit situation.

TunableTuple.name: _worker_npc_job
TunableTuple.description: The job and corresponding role state for the worker NPC.

Tunable.name: role_state
Tunable.description: A role state the sim assigned to the job will perform

Tunable.name: situation_job
Tunable.description: A reference to a SituationJob that can be performed at this Situation.
